entry.title: Game: The Last of Us Remastered (PS4, 2014) (6)
entry.content:
Game: The Last of Us Remastered (PS4, 2014) (6)20150806
I played through the ending and then did the Left Behind DLC.

As someone who knows Salt Lake City really well, it was kind of
disappointing that it didn't look very accurate. I'm glad they
included the temple, because it is iconic, but it was in the
totally wrong place and didn't even look very accurate. There
wasn't even a Moroni on top!

The ending of the main game was pretty intense. I felt like the
combat had a nice conclusion and the emotional impact of Joel's
choice was pretty intense. It was kind of crazy how the doctors
were totally defenseless at the end.

I really liked the Left Behind DLC. The story reveals in the
flashback were pretty touching. I was getting lesbian vibes for
most of it and wasn't too surprised when they kissed. It feels
really cheap and fan-fic-y to do that though. I really liked the
part where she plays the game. It was very cute and fun.

The non-flashback part was really intense. It took a lot of what I
liked about the main game and crammed it into a tight
experience. I was able to do lots of stealth and there was lots of
impact in the story telling. I think my favourite little detail
was when Ellie ignored the comic in the pharmacy because she's
just thinking about Joel.

Total time: 16:27
  • Video Games
  • The Last of Us Remastered
  • PS4
  • 2014

entry.title: Book: Killing Floor, by Lee Child (1997) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Killing Floor, by Lee Child (1997) (2)20150806
I finished this today. The resolution was very exciting and the
plot was real fun. I'm surprised they didn't kill off Roscoe. I saw
the twist coming quite a distance away. I will definitely read more.
  • Books
  • 1997

entry.title: Game: The Last of Us Remastered (PS4, 2014) (5)
entry.content:
Game: The Last of Us Remastered (PS4, 2014) (5)20150805
I played for a long time today broken up into a bunch of
relatively short bursts. I played up until you get to the entrance
of the SLC area. I really liked the part when you play as
Ellie. It was easily the best part of the game so far. It had a
lot of powerful melding of the gameplay and the story, which the
game doesn't normally do and it created some consequences for all
the violence and destruction that occurs earlier in the story.

Total time: 12:47
  • Video Games
  • The Last of Us Remastered
  • PS4
  • 2014

entry.title: Game: The Last of Us Remastered (PS4, 2014) (4)
entry.content:
Game: The Last of Us Remastered (PS4, 2014) (4)20150804
I played for about an hour and a half. I'm about to sneak out of
Pittsburgh with the people I found. I had lots of fights and am
getting better at doing the combat correctly. I still don't love
the gameplay, but it is fun enough.

entry.title: Movie: Birdman, starring Michael Keaton (2014)
entry.content:
Movie: Birdman, starring Michael Keaton (2014)20150731
I really liked and noticed the way it was shot as-if it were a
single shot, which was really cool. The story was very
self-indulgent and stupid. You can just see it as the pathetic
struggle of Hollywood actors. Nevertheless, the acting and carrying
out of the story was very good.
  • Movies
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: The Fighter, starring Mark Wahlberg (2010)
entry.content:
Movie: The Fighter, starring Mark Wahlberg (2010)20150731
This was an exciting story and it was extra exciting because of the
connection to Lowell, which I didn't know going in to the movie
(because I didn't really know anything about it other than the
actors.) The acting is really great and the story is pretty epic.
  • Movies
  • 2010

entry.title: Movie: Laggies, starring Keira Knightly (2014)
entry.content:
Movie: Laggies, starring Keira Knightly (2014)20150731
I found this to be a really cute movie. I liked her struggle and I
thought it was fun way how she dealt with it. I enjoyed the little
moments with the kids and how it was a view to life in that stage
of life. And, of course, Keira Knightly is a major babe.
  • Movies
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: There Will Be Blood, starring Daniel Day-Lewis (2007)
entry.content:
Movie: There Will Be Blood, starring Daniel Day-Lewis (2007)20150731
This is a crazy story with a very impressive characterization of
greed and drive. The most compelling thing about it is the very
interesting period of time that he lives in and the little inklings
you get of how oil production worked at the time.
  • Movies
  • 2007

entry.content:
Movie: The Gambler, starring Mark Wahlberg (2014)20150730
This was a depressing movie about a stupid person making lots of
stupid choices and the anxiety that comes from those decisions. It
was absurd.

entry.content:

entry.title: Movie: Last Knights, starring Clive Owen (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Last Knights, starring Clive Owen (2015)20150726
This was a very interesting movie. I liked the world that it was
set in and the action was neat. I felt that the sacrifice was kind
of dumb and hard to appreciate. I would have cared more if Raiden
led a war and actually improved things. After reading the Wikipedia
page, I learned it was based on the 47 Ronin, which makes things
make much more sense in retrospect.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: The Last of Us Remastered (PS4, 2014) (2)
entry.content:
Game: The Last of Us Remastered (PS4, 2014) (2)20150725
I played for about five hours and got to the middle of the
Pittsburgh chapter. I find the story and the world to be pretty
interesting for the way it gets the characters to talk to each
other. I really like playing in Spanish, because the cursing has
such a less effect on me and the lack of gore is great. I think
the gameplay is pretty bad and feels really sloppy. The characters
have really unrealistic defenses, but very realistic offenses,
which just makes it seem like it's a badly programmed action
game. I'm enjoying it enough though, especially when I manage to
sneak through an area. I feel like I'm not getting enough things
to improve my equipment and stats given how long I expect the game
to be.

Total time: 5:35
  • Video Games
  • The Last of Us Remastered
  • PS4
  • 2014

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 15: Episode Duscae (PS4, 2015) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 15: Episode Duscae (PS4, 2015) (2)20150724
I played for another half-an-hour and had a pretty fun time. I
went through the cave to get Ramuh and then went and killed the
Behemoth after fighting it and having to run away the first
time. What an epic summon. That can't possibly be a thing that you
can use all the time because it would just destroy everything when
you hit 0 health. I found the rhythm of the battle to be a bit
better today. I think the big thing was that I used lots of
warp-strikes and that kept things intense.

Total time: 2:27
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 15: Episode Duscae
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: The Last of Us Remastered (PS4, 2014)
entry.content:
Game: The Last of Us Remastered (PS4, 2014)20150724
I "played" through the opening and found it pretty good at
building the world and giving you a sense of the scale and
importance of the events. I thought there was too much swearing,
but I liked that you could turn off the Gore. I think I will play
it in Spanish or something so I won't be able to hear the swearing
(I'll just read the subtitles.)

I intend to play more of it this weekend.

Total time: 0:25
  • Video Games
  • The Last of Us Remastered
  • PS4
  • 2014

entry.title: Book: Watchmen, by Alan Moore (1986) (6)
entry.content:
Book: Watchmen, by Alan Moore (1986) (6)20150724
I finally finished the book. What a weird ending. There was no
great confrontation with the villain and it never really explained
what happened to the people. I was especially interested in
Dr. Manhattan.
  • Books
  • 1986
